Detailed Description

This class is used to get Geolocation permissions from, and set them on the WebView.

For example, it could be used to allow a user to manage Geolocation permissions from a browser's UI.

Permissions are managed on a per-origin basis, as required by the Geolocation spec - http://dev.w3.org/geo/api/spec-source.html. An origin specifies the scheme, host and port of particular frame. An origin is represented here as a string, using the output of WebCore::SecurityOrigin::toString.

This class is the Java counterpart of the webkit C++ GeolocationPermissions class. It simply marshalls calls from the UI thread to the webkit thread.

Within webkit, Geolocation permissions may be applied either temporarily (for the duration of the page) or permanently. This class deals only with permanent permissions.

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::webkit::GeolocationPermissions::allow ( const gaia::base::String &  origin)

Allows the specified origin.

This method may be called before the webkit thread has int32_tialized the message handler. Messages will be queued until this time.

This method may be called before the webkit thread has int32_tialized the message handler. Messages will be queued until this time.

void gaia::webkit::GeolocationPermissions::getAllowed ( const gaia::base::String &  origin,
const ValueCallback< bool > &  callback 
)

Gets the permission state for the specified origin.

Callback is a ValueCallback object whose onReceiveValue method will be called asynchronously with the permission state for the origin.

void gaia::webkit::GeolocationPermissions::getOrigins ( const ValueCallback< StringVector > &  callback)

Gets the set of origins for which Geolocation permissions are stored.

Note that we represent the origins as strings. These are created using WebCore::SecurityOrigin::toString(). As long as all 'HTML 5 modules' (Database, Geolocation etc) do so, it's safe to match up origins based on this string.

Callback is a ValueCallback object whose onReceiveValue method will be called asynchronously with the set of origins.
